Organs/Tissues: Human intestinal epithelium (small intestine or colon regions)
Physiological/Pathological: Physiological barrier function, can induce pathological states (IBD inflammation, drug-induced damage)
Cell Source: Primary adult intestinal stem cells (multiple donors/segments: duodenum, jejunum, ileum, colon)
Multiple Cell Types: Yes, multiple epithelial subtypes (enterocytes, goblet, enteroendocrine), no stromal or immune cells by default
Circulating Immune: No, though user can add immune factors externally
Crosstalk (Multi-tissue): Single gut epithelium; can be integrated with liver chips externally
Extracellular Matrix: Coated membrane with ECM proteins for cell attachment
Notable Features: Easy to use kit in 96- or 12-well Transwell plates, region-specific GI cells, supports high throughput screening
Plate/Format (Throughput): Commercial 96-well or 12-well plates with Transwell inserts
Max Culture Duration: ~2 weeks total (7-8 days to differentiate, then 3-5 days stable function)
Readouts - Live Imaging: Yes, membrane is transparent for microscopy
Readouts - Supernatant Sampling: Yes (apical & basolateral compartments) for permeability, secreted factors
Readouts - Cell Retrieval: Yes, cells can be lysed or detached for molecular assays
Readouts - Whole Tissue: Yes, fix entire monolayer on membrane for histology/IF
Readouts - TEER: Yes, standard TEER measurement with electrodes
Readouts - Integrated Biosensors: No built-in; rely on external assays (TEER device, imaging, etc.)
Perfused: No, static culture with routine media changes
Real-time Microenvironment Control: User can dose apical/basolateral compartments, measure TEER repeatedly
model_availability: Kits sold by Altis for in-lab use or as a service via contract testing

Organs/Tissues: Human intestinal epithelium with stem-cell crypt architecture (long-term renewal)
Physiological/Pathological: More dynamic crypt-villus axis replication, can model injury/repair, IBD, chronic toxicity
Cell Source: Primary adult intestinal stem cells from various GI regions (small/large intestine)
Multiple Cell Types: Multiple epithelial lineages (proliferative crypt cells + differentiated enterocytes/goblet), no external stroma/immune
Stromal Cells: No, purely epithelial with stem cell zone in crypt-like structure
Circulating Immune: No, but can add inflammatory signals exogenously
Crosstalk (Multi-tissue): Single tissue model, can be connected externally if needed
Extracellular Matrix: Hydrogel or coated membrane supporting crypt formation
3D Scaffold: Semi-3D micro-architecture forming crypt pockets, but overall plate-based
Notable Features: Longer-term viability with ongoing crypt-based proliferation, enabling repeated injury/regeneration studies
Plate/Format (Throughput): Similar to Planar, 12- or 96-well format but specialized crypt inserts
Max Culture Duration: Up to ~2 weeks with crypt maintenance, potentially longer than Planar
Readouts - Live Imaging: Yes, can see crypt formation, use fluorescence for cell lineage tracking
Readouts - Supernatant Sampling: Yes, separate apical/basolateral sides for biomarker or permeability checks
Readouts - Whole Tissue: Yes, fix and stain entire crypt structure in well
Readouts - TEER: Yes, standard TEER approach for barrier integrity
Dead Volume: Low volume in each Transwell well
Perfused: No, manual media changes in static environment
Real-time Microenvironment Control: Dosing of test compounds or inflammatory mediators at intervals, TEER over time
model_availability: Available as kit or service through Altis
